poem:
Title: Of Birds Metal and Diplomacy

Over deep seas, silhouettes of steel,
Silence pierced by drone and whir.
A dozen rooks, sharp and unreal,
Inscribed a shadowed threat of war.

On the wake of whispers from distant men,
Came this cacophony of flight.
And as the wake fades, I wonder when 
Will diplomacy's quill embroider night? 

For words of peace, like softest rain,
Can soothe the thunderbird's strident pain.

You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
